oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nashville Banner, Tennessee Welcomes the Boys of the First Regiment
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Broadside welcoming the Tennessee First Regiment back from service in the Philippines. Photographs of First Regiment commanding officer Lt. Colonel Gracey Childers is featured, along with sketched portraits of James Robertson, James K. Polk, John Sevier, Andrew Jackson, Nathan Bedford Forrest, and Samuel Houston.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides

Broadsides; Philippines - History - Philippine-American War, 1899-1902; Robertson, James, 1742-1814; Polk, James K. (James Knox), 1795-1849; Sevier, John, 1745-1815; Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845; Forrest, Nathan Bedford, 1821-1877; Houston, Sam, 1793-1863
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Brandon Nash
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Tennessee First Volunteer Regiment mustered in May 1898 at Nashville's Cherokee Park and was sent to reinforce the United States' newly acquired Philippine possessions. The Regiment was deployed until it was mustered out in 1901. The Nashville Banner began printing in 1876 and ceased in 1998.
